Event.EventDescription: This public event brings together leading experts to discuss what causes dementia, why early diagnosis is important, and the latest Australian research into treating this disease.

Event.EventName: Mayday! Re-examining Canberraâ€™s deadliest plane crash
Event.EventDescription: On 13 August 1940, Canberra's most fatal disaster took place when a Hudson bomber crashed into a hillside near the Canberra Airport, killing all ten on board. A team of forensic experts will walk through several possible scenarios of the ill-fated flight using today's forensic techniques.
This event is part of the AMOS National Science Week Seminars.

Discover what causes earthquakes, tsunami or find out about our hidden mineral resources. Spot the roving dinosaur, pan for gold, search for sapphires, experience the chill of Antarctica, see the world in 3D or simply take a walk through geological time.

Royal Botanic Gardens and Taronga Zoo staff will present a video conference from Taronga Zoo's studio. Students will be able to interact with the presenters as they explore the adaptations of live animals and plants from a range of environments.
Event.EventPayment: $120 per session. Classroom sizes of 30 recommended.

Event.EventDescription: Expert biologists, including staff from Taronga Zoo and the Royal Botanic Gardens will deliver specialised workshops and video conference sessions that excite and inspire students to understand and care for animals and plants.
Event.EventPayment: The cost of a regular excursion to the Zoo.

Event.EventDescription: Using scientific drawing to understand animal classification and adaptations.

Event.EventName: Arnhem Land Science Fair - sharing the knowledge
Event.EventCategory: Science & Technology ~ Human Body and Movement
Event.EventDescription: What causes a rainbow? Why do cats always land on their feet? What makes popcorn pop? Why do boats float? What person has never asked these questions? Keep asking why and ignite your passion for science.
Come and try your very own fossil dig. Uncover a 40 million year old fossil that you can catalogue and take home to start your own collection.

As a leader in marine science education and research, Southern Cross Universityâ€™s National Marine Science Centre (NMSC) aims to promote greater awareness of the marine environment and scientific processes during National Science Week through a series of hands-on activities, displays and presentations.

Event.EventName: 2013 South Australian Science Excellence Awards Gala Dinner
Event.EventDescription: The South Australian Science Excellence Awards Gala Dinner is the premier event in South Australia's science and research calendar, where the finalists and winners of the Science Excellence Awards are announced and celebrated.
Event.EventPayment: TBA

Event.EventCategory: Science & Technology ~ Human Body and Movement
Event.EventDescription: Fun excursions conducted by Physics is Fun at Luna Park in Sydney.

Event.EventName: DANscienCE Festival: where dance and science meet
Event.EventCategory: Science & Technology ~ Human Body and Movement
Event.EventDescription: Hosted by the Canberra Dance Theatre (CDT) in association with Ausdance, QL2 Dance, CSIRO Discovery Centre and DanceKids, the week-long festival will bring together Canberra leaders in the fields of artistic and scientific research.

Event.EventName: Awards Day - 2013 DAFF Hermitage Schools Plant Science Competition
Event.EventDescription: Hermitage Research Facility will again be hosting the annual Awards Day for the DAFF Hermitage Research Facility Schools Plant Science Competition. All students registered for the 2013 competition are welcome to attend.
A competition between primary schools on the Redcliffe Peninsula and surrouding areas. The competition is to combine showmanship, maths, science, and gleeful mayhem.
An exhibition of solutions to the environmental and sustainability crisis facing the globe.
